title: Exhaust Header Pipes - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Always note the position and orientation of exhaust clamps prior to releasing them, and return them to the noted position and orientation on assembly.
Removal seat, battery, fuel tank DB4; DBB; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU4; DUB; DUC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DTC; DU4; DT4; DB4

body.body: Loosen the clamp securing the exhaust header pipe to the catalytic converter.

body.name: Header to Catalyst Clamp (cjcr_3) DB4 DU4 DT4

body.body: Note the routing of the oxygen sensor harness for installation.
The oxygen sensor electrical connections must not be swapped between cylinders. If the connections are swapped over, engine malfunctions will occur.
The right hand (Cylinder 2) oxygen sensor harness has a small section of red tape for identification (main harness side).
The oxygen sensors are NOT marked. Always ensure the right hand oxygen sensor harness is connected to the correct main harness connector, identified by the red tape.
Remove the fixing and washer securing the harness connector bracket to the frame.
If removing the left hand oxygen sensor omit steps 3 to 5 then continue from step 6 to the end of the instructions.
If removing the right hand oxygen sensor omit steps to 6 to 8 then continue to the end of the instructions.
Remove and discard the fixings securing the right hand headstock cable guide. Remove the cable guide.
Release the locking device and detach the right hand oxygen sensor connector from the harness connector bracket.
Disconnect the oxygen sensor from the main harness.
Right hand oxygen sensor connector (harness side)
The fixings securing the left hand headstock cable guide also secures the headstock cover panel to the frame.
Remove and discard the fixings securing the left hand headstock cable guide. Remove the cable guide and the headstock cover panel.
Release the locking device and detach the left hand oxygen sensor connector from the harness connector bracket.
Disconnect the oxygen sensor from the main harness.
Left hand oxygen sensor connector (harness side)
Remove the fixings and the finned clamps securing the exhaust header pipe to the cylinder head.

body.name: Header pipe to cylinder head cjcq

body.body: Remove the clamp securing the rear of the exhaust header pipe to the exhaust catalytic converter link pipe.
Detach the exhaust header pipe from the catalytic converter, remove the exhaust header pipe. Remove and discard the gasket from the cylinder head ports.
Remove and discard the exhaust header pipe gasket from the catalytic converter.
If necessary, remove the oxygen sensors.
